metadata.Title: CVE-2020-26958 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: Firefox did not block execution of scripts with incorrect MIME types when the response was intercepted and cached through a ServiceWorker. This could lead to a cross-site script inclusion vulnerability, or a Content Security Policy bypass. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 83, Firefox ESR < 78.5, and Thunderbird < 78.5.

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '83.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
